releaseText: The following upgrade is a major Kubernetes upgrade. Please refer to the notes for more details.

desc.title: Improved monitoring system
desc.text:
As part of improving the monitoring system, the traffic between containers will be monitored by the platform team for internal purposes. Grafana dashboards will be used for this activity. 
 Additionally, the NSC platform team will receive alerts when resources are overutilized. For example, if a pod’s memory utilization crosses 80% of the threshold limit, the platform team will receive alerts. The team will then proactively inform the users about the over-utilization so that resources can be increased to ensure smoothing running of pods and subsequently, the user jobs.

desc.title: Enhanced node readiness
desc.text:
Pods utilize most of the resources in a node. A node also requires resources to run system daemons to power the operating system (OS) and Kubernetes. When nodes do not have resources for system daemons, they slip from the readiness state. Setting aside resources for system daemons will ensure that nodes are in ready state. 
 To set aside resources for system daemons, kubelet arguments will be added to the kubelet service.

desc.title: Upgraded Kubernetes
desc.text: Kubernetes regularly gets new security updates to improve the security and functioning of the system in which it is being used. So, in the current release, the Kubernetes infrastructure including the underlying nodes is being upgraded from V_1.10 to V_1.13.3.

desc.title: Upgraded load Balancer
desc.text: A load balancer patch will be implemented to reduce the recovery time of the load balancers, when they get restarted.
